result.execSummary:
The defendant Terry J Howell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Shall undergo and follow through with any treatment as directed by agent

ADDRESS INFO for Terry J Howell
Current: 104 East Oak St, Westville, IL 61883 United States  (Effective: 10-30-2015)
Prior: 533 Sweetbriar Lane, Watertown, WI 53098
Defendant's request to return to residence

Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with B.A.H., dob 2/26/61, the children or the residence.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not go on the premises at 533 Sweetbriar Lane, Watertown, WI, Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.

Defendant Terry J Howell in court, in custody with attorney Ramniq Button (jail only) . Kurt Klomberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received copy of Criminal Complaint and advised of rights, charges and penalties. Court finds probable cause. State heard on bond; Atty. Button objects to no contact order; RD 11/9/15 at 2:30pm & JT 12/8/15 at 8:15am in Br. 4; Court sets $500.00 PA Bond with conditions:   Defendant shall not have any direct or indirect contact or communication with B.A.H., dob 7/26/61, the children or the residence. Defendant shall not go on the premises at 533 Sweetbrian Lane, Watertown, WI, Defendant may go to the residence at issue one time in the company of a uniformed law enforcement officer to retrieve his/her personal property.  Defendant shall not have any violent or abusive contact with anyone.  Defendant shall not use/possess/control any controlled substances (without a valid prescription therefore) or drug paraphernalia, nor be in the presence of anyone who does.
